attributes.title: Stock Take
attributes.description:
A physical stock take was conducted on 25.02.2025 with the aim of establishing whether internal controls were effective and whether physical stock items were matching with those in the SAP system. 

        After stock take, it was noted that most stock items had nil variations with exception to;

  •           Bread stock had -76.75pieces cumulatively

  •           Poly bags had a variance of -705pieces cumulatively

  •           Wheat bran variance of +2.106kgs

  •           Utto had a variance of -0.911 litres

  •          Crate balance as at the time of stock take was 40 pcs

         Details of the findings were as illustrated  in the table below;
attributes.recommendation:
The branch management should enhance control of stock items so as to eliminate variances noted.

         Branch sales representative should make a follow up so as to control the crate balance in supermarkets
attributes.effect: From the analysis above, there was lapses in polybags control as depicted by the variance.
attributes.remediation_plan: Branch management to enhance control of bread production and polybags usage so as to reduce  variance noted.

value:
I will be making follow up to ensure stocks are controlled so as to eliminated variances noted

         The balances in crates are in supermarkets and a follow up is being done by to reduce the balance.

We will enhance control of stocks so as to reduce variances noted

        A follow up on crates balance is being made to ensure its reduced and control balance
In a prior audit report dated 02.02.25 bread ha a variance of +02 loaves and Cumulative variance in polybags was +1,041 pieces
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Weight check
attributes.description:
Bread produced and packed in the branch were weighed randomly to determine if bread dispatched to the market was of the correct weight.

         From the sample selected audit noted that all varieties weighed had underweight cases with exception to 600g white as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: Spot checks should be enhanced to ensure all production parameters are followed so as to eliminate cases of underweight.
attributes.effect: Underweight bread dispatched to market exposes the company to risk of penalties if they are intercepted by the weight and measures officials.
attributes.remediation_plan: A follow up of set dividing ranges and set production guidelines will eliminate cases of underweight

value: We will enhance spot checks from the dividing table to packing to ensure set standards on dividing and packing are strictly adhered to
Underweight cases in the branch are fairly controlled. However, we will enhance controls and spot checks to eliminate few cases noted.
In a prior audit report underweight cases were as follows; 600g white 2.67%, 800g white 1.33% and 600g Barrel white 18.67%
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Bread Damages Check
attributes.description:
An analysis of production and market/supermarket damages was done to determine whether they were within the allowed percentage of 0.2% to total production and 0.5% of total sales respectively.

         A sample period of 24 days (1 to 24 February 2025) was used to analyse bread damages. Audit noted that percentage of average production damages stood at 0.20% of the total production while average market damages was 0.50% of total sales.

         The table below illustrates the findings;

Damages sent to Ingredients

         For the period damages sent to ingredients were less by 7.13kgs
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should control bread damages by ensuring all production procedures are being followed and bread produced is of good quality so as to reduce production and market damages.
attributes.effect: Both production and market bread damages were within set limits meaning the company was not losing revenue through excess damages
attributes.remediation_plan: They have met set target. However, the branch management should enhance production control so as to reduce the level of damages

value: We are trying our best to control bread damages in the branch by ensuring we produce quality bread
Both production and market damages are within the set parameter. However, control from the supervisors and manager is need so as to reduce the percentages.
In a prior audit report from 1st to 27th January 2025 average production damages stood at 0.19% of total production and market damages stood at 0.51%
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Mixing Chart Analysis
attributes.description:
Mixing charts and mixing chart summaries from 1 to 24 February 2025 were examined to find out the branch’s utto consumption, average yield, cases of remix and summation of totals

  •          After examining the records the follow were noted;

  •         Average yield per bag was191.59 loaves per bag.

  •         Utto consumption was at 84%. (One bag is supposed to use 0.143litres meaning they should have used 323.61litres for 2,263 bags produced. However, in the MCS from 1 to 24 February 2025 they had indicated 273 litres)

  •        Average production was 94.29 bags per day representing 84.19% of target which is 112 bags per day (Branch Capacity)

         The table below illustrates the findings;

         Audit noted that recording of charts and mixing charts summaries were not matching. For instance:

  •         On 02.02.25 Mixing chart for 2nd shift had more bags (31) recorded as produced while those transferred to summary were 30 bags.

  •         On 13.02.25 Mixing chart for 3rd shift had 27 bags but those transferred to the summary were 26 bags
attributes.recommendation:
Recording of charts should be followed or be checked by the supervisors/ manager on daily basis after stock take to ensure figures transferred to the mixing chart summary match those of charts before posting in the system is done

         Further dividers or mixers should record a mix after dividing and not before.

        On those days the branch run on full capacity, the branch management should ensure production target is achieved.
attributes.effect:
Target production in bags was not achieved meaning the branch’s capacity was under utilized

         By the two documents having different details  (i.e. mixing chart and mixing chart summary) it implies that there was lapses in checking and supervision in production area
attributes.remediation_plan: A follow up by the branch manager and supervisors to ensure details of mixing charts are correctly transferred to mixing chart summary before booking them in the system

value:
I will be checking the mixing charts and summaries to ensure the recording is done correctly before posting

Production is affected by market demand.

I have informed the manager to be checking charts and summaries to ensure that they are correctly filled.

Our production target keeps changing depending on market demand
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Debtors Analysis
attributes.description: Outstanding debts were analysed as at 1 March 2025 to check the magnitude. It was observed that the customers had outstanding balance of Ksh 17,564.47 as illustrated below;
attributes.recommendation:
A follow up should be made by sales rep to ensure customers with debt do pay and clear while those with security deposit the same is used to offset outstanding balances.

         The Tuktuk driver should be asked to make daily payment so as to clear the balance.
attributes.effect: Customers with debts exposes the company to risk of losing its revenue
attributes.remediation_plan: A follow up on the outstanding amount should be followed up to ensure the company does not loss its revenue.

value: The Sales rep is following up so as the balances are cleared
The sales rep is following up to ensure the balances are cleared
Current
Sales Department

attributes.title: Production Efficiency
attributes.description:
Production efficiency calculation the month of February 2024 (1.24.02.25) was done to determine if the production workers hired were achieving the set production efficiency of 4.5 bags per worker.

         It was noted that the average production efficiency was 4.49 bags per production worker as illustrated in the table below;
attributes.recommendation: The branch management should allocate production workers as per production target shift wise so as to ensure set efficiency is achieved
attributes.effect: The branch missed to achieve the set production efficiency target slightly meaning that the cost of production was above set budget
attributes.remediation_plan: The branch management should check what might be affecting target achievement if there are no breakdown of Machinery and the right number of production workers are hired

value: We are trying our best so as to achieve set target of 4.5 bags per production worker
We missed the target slightly but we are working towards achieving the set target.
From prior audit report average production efficiency was 4.5 bags per production worker
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Packing Efficiency
attributes.description:
Packing efficiency was calculated from 1 to 24 February 2025 so as to determine if the packers hired were achieving the set packing efficiency of 97 crates per packer.

         It was noted that the average packing efficiency was 93.09 crates per packer as illustrated below;

Note: The branch hired a Naivas Supermarket Packer in 3rd shift daily. This packer was not included on number of packers used to calculate efficiency of 93.09 crates per packer
attributes.recommendation:
Hiring of Packers shift wise should be guided by the number of bags produced in the prior shift. This will enable the branch to achieve set target.

        Operation’s department should give a clear guideline on the Naivas Supermarket Packer who is hired in 3rd shift whether to be included while calculating efficiency
attributes.effect: Average packing efficiency was below the set target and this implies that packing cost was above the set budget hence an extra cost to the company
attributes.remediation_plan: Packers should be hired shift wise after taking into consideration the number of bags produced in the prior shift. This will enable the branch to achieve set target.

value: Packing efficiency was below set target but we will try our best to improve the efficiency

More effort to be put in place by the team to ensure that packing efficiency per person is achieved. The Naivas supermarket Packer should be counted when computing efficiency as currently we are not packing huge volumes for Naivas.
From prior audit report average packing efficiency was 95.97 crates per packer
Current
Operations/Production Department

attributes.title: Vehicle Mileage and Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
Analysis of fuel consumption was done from 1 to 25 February 2025 to assess the following;

  •       Whether the standard mileage set for each vehicle was being met

         It was noted that Town II, Kendu-bay vehicles and Tuktuk were consuming more fuel than set standard while Keroka  vehicle was saving fuel as illustrated in Appendix 1 below;
attributes.recommendation: Consumption for those routes where vehicles consume more than set standard should be rechecked to ensure fuel usage is within set standards
attributes.effect: By consuming more fuel than set standard means that the cost of distributing products is on the higher side than budgeted for in a given route.
attributes.remediation_plan: A retest of vehicles consuming fuel more than set standard should be done to determine the accurate rate which should be used.

value: We are trying our level best to control overconsumption. For Kendu-bay route a recovery for overconsumption was done.
We will enhance control of fuel consumption. Over consuming in Kendu-bay route had been recovered.
Current
Transport/Fleet Department

attributes.title: Generator Fuel Consumption Analysis
attributes.description:
The generator consumption rate was reviewed from 1 to 28 February 2025 so as to determine the consumption rate. Average consumption for the period was 32.51litres per hour. During the period 543 litres of fuel had been purchased and the generator had run for 16.7hours.

         When odometer hours as at 28 February were compared with the system hours, it was noted that the system was reading 16.28hrs while the genset was reading 219.23hrs
attributes.recommendation: A follow up with system providers should be done so that the system calibration is checked to ensure the information is matching with the one in the grounds in terms of fuel refill and hours run
attributes.effect: With two different reading of hours run by the generator, it’s difficult to ascertain the accurate consumption as the two set will give different figures.
attributes.remediation_plan: System providers should be informed of different reading of engine hours so that calibration can be redone

value: We usually refill genset as per the litres we are given from operation department monthly
The consumption rate is within standard. Generator system review should be conducted by the service providers.
Current
Transport/Fleet Department
